text.text1: The 'Decision Support' tool considers the supply situation in services of general interest according to your self-selected criteria.
text.text2: As a result, you receive various layers on the supply situation. These can be used, for example, to assess the supply situation, analyze demand, and identify structural spatial differences.

text.text1: Select the population's age groups at the place of residence that you want to consider for the analysis:
Minimum accessibility standards (travel distance/travel time) to facilities and services of general interest ensure nationwide supply coverage.
text.text2: If the corresponding threshold values are reached, it can be assumed that there is an undersupply. Likewise, the quality of supply increases the shorter the travel distance from the place of residence to the infrastructure. Recommended values are already stored for the selected infrastructures. They apply to accessibility by car. The preset travel times can be adjusted for demand-oriented simulations.

text.text4: In addition, for each of the selected infrastructures, store which supply situation should occur when a certain travel time is exceeded to reach this infrastructure from the demand location. The categories are divided as follows:
text.text5: If the travel time from the demand location to the infrastructure exceeds the deficient supply threshold, no supply to the demand location is provided by the infrastructure.

text.text1: It is possible to assign individual weightings to determine how important each infrastructure should be in your analysis.
text.text2: You can assign values between 0 and 100 using the slider. Please note that a value of 0 means that the infrastructure is not included in the analysis.
